greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest prime factor of the composites in the n-th prime gap larger than 2.
comment: The largest prime factor of numbers in the interval [A136798(n),A136799(n)].
The sequence is obtained from A052248 by removing terms from composites in prime gaps of size 2.
example: a(1)=5 because the composites in the run from 8, 9, 10 contain prime factors 2, 3, and 5, with 5 being the largest at N=10.
maple: A136798 := proc(n) local a; if n = 1 then 8; else a := nextprime( procname(n-1))+1 ; while nextprime(a)-a <=2 do a := nextprime(a)+1 ; od; RETURN(a) ; fi; end:
A136801 := proc(n) local a,i; i := A136798(n) ; a := A006530( i) ; while not isprime(i+1) do i := i+1 ; a := max(a, A006530(i)) ; od: a ; end:
results.author: _Enoch Haga_, Jan 24 2008
